intro: Beloperone monticola, commonly known as the mountain beloperone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, often at higher elevations where it thrives in cooler climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered, producing a distinctive yellowish-green hue. Beloperone monticola is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
